events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 1st involving their vehicle and another driver.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal vehicle in a collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the claimant's case and coordinate the next steps for processing.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer the case is being handled promptly.
Request sent to the customer for accident photos, police report, and vehicle registration documents to support the claim.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police report and vehicle repair estimate promptly.
The investigation team began reviewing the claim details, documents, and contacted witness statements for verification.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured party was not at fault; vehicle collision verified through submitted evidence.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant to cover all damages including vehicle repair costs and rental car fees.
Customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the settlement offer and the responsiveness of the insurance team.
The claim was formally approved after acceptance of the settlement, authorizing payment for the damages covered.
Payment was successfully issued to the customer covering all approved repair costs and related expenses.
The claim was officially closed with all processes completed and the customer notified accordingly.
The claim was archived in the records for future reference and regulatory compliance purposes.
